headline.main: EDEN SAYS ALLIES MUST STAY UNITED; Stresses Need of 4 Powers to Curb Germany and Japan After the War SEES NO RIFT WITH SOVIET Foreign Secretary Warns That Cooperation Will Be Difficult in 'Inevitable Reaction'

lead_paragraph: LONDON, DEC. 2 -- The mutual dependence of the United Nations after the war must be recognized as the cornerstone of peace and prosperity for the whole world after the conflict ends, Foreign Secretary Anthony Eden told the House of Commons today, winding up the two-day debate on the Labor amendment calling for a postwar program.
abstract: Brit Foreign Sec Eden on United Nations unity
snippet: LONDON, DEC. 2 -- The mutual dependence of the United Nations after the war must be recognized as the cornerstone of peace and prosperity for the whole world after the conflict ends, Foreign Secretary Anthony Eden told the House of Commons today, ...

byline.original: By DAVID ANDERSONSpecial to THE NEW YORK TIMES
